org.swisscheese.swisscheese.engine.rendering

Class SingleThreadedRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.swisscheese.swisscheese.engine.rendering.Renderer
      • org.swisscheese.swisscheese.engine.rendering.SingleThreadedRenderer

  • public class SingleThreadedRenderer
extends Renderer
    Display Object for rendering graphics on screen.

    The rendering method and the single-threaded nature of this class makes the game run poorly with higher screen resolutions. Two possible solutions exist for improving the game performance:

  • Assigning a single scan line to an executor from a thread-pool
  • Breaking the screen up into chunks, and each thread gets a chunk

    • With the first solution, the threads do not have to do the same amount of work. If one thread is faster, that wouldn't affect the final outcome. Also, it would be easy to specify how many threads will do the rendering. However, this solution could result in heavier resource usage due to object creation.

    If the screen was broken-up into chunks, then the current render(int[]) method only needs to be slightly modified to work with the chunks. However, the amount of threads needs to be an even number, and it would be difficult to work with many threads (if the client CPU supports). Also, it is possible that one thread would complete working on a chunk, while a lagging thread would slow down the performance.

    Strip solution would be attempted first, and if it is not good enough, the chunk solution would be tried and implemented.

Since:
2018-12-10, v0.2
Version:
v0.2
Author:
Alex Kalinins

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public int[] render(int[] pixels)
        Renders what the player is seeing through Camera. Renders into an array of ints (pixels) through ray-casting.

        This algorithm goes through each vertical strip of the pixels array and calculates the distance between the location of the player and the wall. The distance is then used to calculate the height of the wall (perspective) in that strip. The algorithm retrieves the color values of the pixels in the texture, and applies them to each pixel in the new line. The new pixel array is returned.

        Overrides:
        render in class Renderer
        Parameters:
        {@code - int} array of pixels (rgb value for each pixel.
        Returns:
        updated pixels array.
        See Also:
        Ray-Casting

      • isMultithreaded

        public boolean isMultithreaded()
        This is a SingleThreadedRenderer. As the name implies, this method can only utilize one thread.
        Specified by:
        isMultithreaded in class Renderer
        Returns:
        false.
